content:
Does anybody know if this parcel tower accepts packages?
https://www.openstreetmap.org/node/11940552140
20240528_220619.jpg
20240528_220611.jpg

Node: ‪Latvijas Pasts paku torņa‬ (‪11940552140‬) | OpenStreetMap
OpenStreetMap is a map of the world, created by people like you and free to use under an open license.
omg what is this :star_struck: and how did I not know it exists

https://pasts.lv/lv/zinas/6577-latvijas-pasts-atklaj-pirmo-paku-torni-inovativu-ietilpigu-un-videi-draudzigaku-sutijumu-izsniegsanas-iekartu says

Klientiem paku tornis būs pieejams visu diennakti septiņas dienas nedēļā, un sākotnēji tas tiks izmantots tikai sūtījumu izsniegšanai, ar laiku aktivizējot arī nosūtīšanas funkciju.

For start it would be receive only but later sending too

I don't know)

Rather tripy thing to be honest. Once you come close, it moves protective glass away to allow interaction with keyboard.
I was not prepared for that and jumped a bit. For a brief moment, I thought it'll grab me, and will put me in the box :scream:
And apparently I've passed it many times and didn't even realize...... I suppose I erased it from memory to avoid nightmares
I think it didn't register with me that this is not some building part that was just painted.

Well, I've gone for a ride to check parcel lockers in the vicinity. All LP lockers I've seen today looked the same. And I was surprised to say the least once I've seen this contraption.
And even though I knew that somewhere there should be a locker, until I come close and this thing moved away it's cover, I couldn't believe this is what i was looking for.
I thought that maybe it's a promotion installation. Or maybe LP rented part of Rimi for some unknown reason.
Yeah, I've been paying attention to lockers and they all look the same - this is like... I would not have ever guessed it was a parcel locker
